intro: Gymnosporia trigyna, commonly known as the three-ovary thornapple, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, though it is not closely related to them. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and compound leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is adapted to arid environments. Gymnosporia trigyna is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
